title: 5 Quick Ways to Sign Out of Your Twitter (X) Account

steps.title: Open the Twitter/X app.
steps.content: Open the Twitter/X app. This looks like a white X with a black background. [1] X Research source X is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You can find this in the top-left corner. This will open the menu to the left. On some devices, this may look like three-lines.

steps.title: Tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings and privacy . You can find this at the bottom of the menu. If you don't see it, you may need to tap Settings and Support first.

steps.title: Tap Your account.
steps.content: Tap Your account . This will be at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Account information.
steps.content: Tap Account information . This is the first option.

steps.title: Tap Log out.
steps.content: Tap Log out . You'll be logged out of your Twitter/X account. On Android, tap OK to log out of your Twitter/X account. [2] X Research source If needed, you can also sign out on all devices at once.

steps.title: Go to https://twitter.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://twitter.com/ in a web browser. If you're logged into an account, you'll see your Twitter/X feed. This method works on any web browser on any device, including mobile devices. [3] X Research source If you want to take a break from X, you can choose to deactivate your account temporarily.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This will be in the bottom-left corner. This will display a pop-up menu. If you are using Twitter in a mobile web browser, it will be in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Click Log out.
steps.content: Click Log out . This will log you out of X and take you to the login screen. If needed, you can delete remembered passwords on your browser.

steps.title: Open the Twitter/X app.
steps.content: Open the Twitter/X app. You can download this from the Microsoft App Store. [4] X Research source If you're already logged into your account, you should see your feed.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. This will be in the bottom-right corner at the bottom of the menu bar to the left. This displays a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Log out.
steps.content: Click Log out . You'll be logged out of your Twitter (X) account.

steps.title: Open Twitter/X.
steps.content: Open Twitter/X. You can open the Twitter/X mobile app or log in using a web browser on your desktop computer.

steps.title: Click More on a desktop or tap your profile icon on mobile.
steps.content: Click More on a desktop or tap your profile icon on mobile. This will display a menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings and privacy . It's near the bottom of the menu. This opens the Settings menu

steps.title: Click or tap Security and account access.
steps.content: Click or tap Security and account access . It's the second option in the "Settings" menu on mobile devices. On a computer, it's about halfway down the menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Apps and sessions.
steps.content: Click or tap Apps and sessions . It's the second option in the "Security and account access" menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Sessions.
steps.content: Click or tap Sessions . This displays a list of all devices and sessions you are currently logged into

steps.title: Click or tap Log out of all other sessions.
steps.content: Click or tap Log out of all other sessions . It's the red text at the top of the list of apps and sessions.

steps.title: Click or tap Log Out.
steps.content: Click or tap Log Out . This confirms that you want to log out of all sessions.

steps.title: Open Twitter/X.
steps.content: Open Twitter/X. You can open the Twitter/X mobile app or log in using a web browser on your desktop computer. If you are logged in to Twitter/X on any third-party apps and accounts (i.e. Google, a game console, etc), you can log out by revoking that app's permission in the Settings menu of your Google account.

steps.title: Click More on a desktop or tap your profile icon on mobile.
steps.content: Click More on a desktop or tap your profile icon on mobile. This will display a menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings and privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings and privacy . It's near the bottom of the menu. This opens the Settings menu. You may have to tap Settings and Support to see this submenu.

steps.title: Click or tap Security and account access.
steps.content: Click or tap Security and account access . It's the second option in the "Settings" menu on mobile devices. On a computer, it's about halfway down the menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Apps and sessions.
steps.content: Click or tap Apps and sessions . It's the second option in the "Security and account access" menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Connected apps.
steps.content: Click or tap Connected apps . This displays a list of all apps you are logged into Twitter with.

steps.title: Click or tap the account or app you want to log out of.
steps.content: Click or tap the account or app you want to log out of. This displays information about the app and what permissions it has.

steps.title: Click or tap Revoke app permissions.
steps.content: Click or tap Revoke app permissions . This will revoke any permissions you have granted the app and log you out of that app. [5] X Research source
